page.title: 13HOUSING IN THE SEISDON AREA
page.content: This is an area of Green Belt and situated as it is only a few kilometres from the West Midlands conurbation it is carefully preserved as such. This means that there is very little scope for new building other than for agricultural purposes. There have been some recent housing developments in that part of the area which lies in the village of Seisdon but practically none elsewhere. Many of the existing buildings are quite old: some date from last century but others have stood for two or three hundred years. A feature of the area is a type of tall brick farmhouse, often rather plain in design. Brick is the usual building material, red or purplish in colour, and roofs are generally made of small, flat tiles.
